alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Warren and northern Washington Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 821 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Chestertown, or 12 miles northeast of Warrensburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Whitehall, Johnsburg, Hague, Rogers Rock Campground, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Chestertown, Huletts Landing, Putnam, Wright, Chipman Point, Starbuckville, Low Hampton, Wevertown, Putnam Station, Pottersville, Snody Dock, Sabbath Day Point, South Horicon and Hampton Flats. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 24 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
